Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVHashtagController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVHashtagController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class TEVHashtagController
extends Object
    REST controller for working with hashtags. Doesn't use RepoAbstractor, since the code is slightly different from working with posts.
    Author:
    tiyb

    • Field Summary

        private static final String BLOG_SEPARATOR

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • TEVHashtagController

    • Method Detail

      • getAllHashtags

        @GetMapping("/hashtags")
public List<Hashtag> getAllHashtags()
        GET request for listing all hashtags in the system, regardless of blog. Because hashtags might be duplicated, logic is included to combine them together.
        Returns:
        List of hashtags with their counts.

      • getAllHashtagsForBlog

        @GetMapping("/hashtags/{blog}")
public List<Hashtag> getAllHashtagsForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                           String blog)
        GET request for listing all hashtags stored in the system for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which hashtags should be returned
        Returns:
        List of all hashtags in the database

      • createHashtagForBlog

        @PostMapping("/hashtags/{blog}")
public Hashtag createHashtagForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                    String blog,
                                    @Valid @RequestBody
                                    @Valid String hashtag)
        POST request to insert a new hashtag into the system for a given blog. If it already exists the existing hashtag is simply returned (no error is thrown).
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which the hashtag should be inserted
        hashtag - The hashtag to be entered into the system
        Returns:
        The new/existing hashtag object (with ID)

      • createHashtagForNoBlog

        @PostMapping("/hashtags/")
public Hashtag createHashtagForNoBlog​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                      @Valid String hashtag)

        POST request to insert a new hashtag into the system with no blog associated with it. Simply calls through to the createHashtagForBlog() method, passing an empty string for the blog name.

        Throws an error if the hashtag already exists in the system, for any other blog

        Parameters:
        hashtag - Hashtag to be created
        Returns:
        The new/existing hashtag object (with ID)

      • deleteAllHashtagsForBlog

        @Transactional
@DeleteMapping("/hashtags/forBlog/{blog}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllHashtagsForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                                                           String blog)
        DEL to delete all hashtags in the DB for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which tags should be deleted
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details

      • deleteHashTag

        @DeleteMapping("/hashtags/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteHashTag​(@PathVariable("id")
                                                                Long hashtagToDelete)
        DEL to delete a particular hashtag from the system, for a given blog
        Parameters:
        hashtagToDelete - ID of the Hashtag to be deleted
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details

      • deleteAllHTs

        public void deleteAllHTs()
        Package-public method to delete all hashtags in the system, regardless of blog. Used only in JUnit tests; no API associated with the method.
